arm_group.description: Nasal spray with saline+glucose twice daily for 3 months
Nasal spray in a bag-on-valve device with 50U/ml glucose oxidase + 5% glucose in isotone saline. Dosage: One puff in each nostril twice daily for 3 months.

brief_summary.textblock:
To investigate if use of glucosoxidas nasal spray can reduce the number of days with
      rhinitis and/or otitis in children beyond 4 years.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nasal Spray With Glucose Oxidase Preventing Common Cold in Pre-school Children

detailed_description.textblock:
Children below 4 years of age and in public day care were invited to participate in this
      prospective study. The children started with a visit to an ENT doctor and after inclusion
      the children started to spray twice daily with glucose oxidase+glucose or only
      saline+glucose for 3 months. During this period the parents were asked to fill in a home
      protocol recording upper respiratory tract symptoms as: rhinitis, cough, fever, ear ache.
      The parent were told to go to the ENT department if they suspected an episode of acute
      otitis media. After 6 weeks and 12 weeks the children had scheduled visits to the ENT
      department. After 12 weeks of treatment a nasopharyngeal swab was taken for bacterial
      culture.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children below 4 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  None

intervention.description: Glucose oxidase is a hydrogen peroxide producing enzyme, imitating the inhibitory effects of the normal bacterial flora of the nasopharynx
intervention.other_name: Nasal spray containing isotonic saline+glucose oxidase+5% glucose

intervention.description: A bag on valve nasal spray device containing isotone saline and 5% glucose
intervention.other_name: Nasal spray containing isotonic saline+5% glucose

clinical_study.official_title: Placebo Controlled Study Among Children Below Four Years of Age, Investigating Whether a Glucose Oxidase Nasal Spray Can Reduce Days With Upper Respiratory Tract Infection Symptoms and Episodes of Otitis Media

primary_outcome.description: Upper respiratory tract infection symptoms during a 3 months period are recorded in a home protocol by the parents of the children.
primary_outcome.measure: Does a nasal spray with glucose oxidase reduce number of days with upper respiratory infectious symptoms and/or episodes of acute otitis media?

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
